messageBody:
On Wednesday 16 June 2004 20:30, J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
> Jagmohan S Nanaware wrote:
> > Hi Robert,
> >
> > Thanks!
> >
> > --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Robert Wenner <robert@p...> wrote:
> > > On Monday 14 June 2004 10:26, Jagmohan S Nanaware wrote:
> > > > Can I test C code using JUnit?
> > >
> > > Yes, using the JNI... but it would be cumbersome.
> > >
> > > > Can I use cppunit?
> > >
> > > Yes. That would be less cumbersome.
> > > Using the right tool may help... funny, isn't it?
> >
> > Well true. However, what is the right tool for me?
>
> I think he's saying that CppUnit is the right tool for you. Since C code
> is valid C++ code,

Not true. There are trivial and not-so-trivial reasons why this is so; also
some valid C code is valid C++ code with different operational behaviour.

The OP may or may not be willing to work in the safe intersection.

There are C unit test harnesses out there; I have looked and found them
(but not so far tried any of them, since it's a sufficiently low priority that
it gets pushed down the stack).
